<div>
I am a data scientist and a political psychologist[^1] with a background in psychometrics, psycholinguistics, cross-cultural research, and modeling subjectivity.
</div>

<br>

<div>
With my current background and formal training, I am a data practitioner in the following methods, techniques and modeling mindsets. Machine learning, deep learning, natural language processing, time series, statistical inference (frequentist & Bayesian), the general structural equation modeling framework, psychometric networks, social network analysis, and survival analysis.
</div>

<br>

<div>
I work as a data scientist at [BCW Global, Europe & Africa](https://www.bcw-global.com/){target="_blank"}. I am also an affiliated Postdoc Fellow at [Bremen Graduate School of Social Sciences](https://www.bigsss-bremen.de/){target="_blank"}. In addition, I currently serve as the Turkish Language Group Leader in the [European Commission Joint Research Centre](https://joint-research-centre.ec.europa.eu/index_en){target="_blank"}â€™s [ValuesML - Unravelling Expressed Values in the Media for Informed Policy Making](https://knowledge4policy.ec.europa.eu/projects-activities/valuesml-unravelling-expressed-values-media-informed-policy-making_en){target="_blank"}project.
</div>

<div>
My domain expertise is particularly relevant to political consulting, targeted  communication, and public administration. My track record includes work on consumer behavior, customer segmentation, institutional culture, and mental well-being.
</div>
